definition: classifier for hair or grass: tuft/Taiwan pr. [cuo4]
to pick up (a powder etc) with the fingertips/to scoop up/to collect together/to extract/to gather up/classifier: pinch/Taiwan pr. [cuo4]
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to play matchmaker/to act as a middleman

sentences.english: Rub cucumber slices with 1 tbsp salt.
sentences.chinese: 用1汤匙盐放入黄瓜段里撮匀。

sentences.english: Consequently, the endings of the hair cluster appear to have been somewhat raised up.
sentences.chinese: 结果，那撮虎毛的未端显得有些翘起来。

sentences.english: I always come here when I want to be well fed.
sentences.chinese: 当我想饱口福时，我总是来这里撮一顿。

sentences.english: Knightley next movie came with a big pinch of grit.
sentences.chinese: 文奈特莉的下一步电影充满着一大撮的毅力。

sentences.english: Rub your hands together. Look, here come the bubbles.
sentences.chinese: 两只手互相撮一撮，瞧，泡沫处来了。

sentences.english: After I swept the floor, I scooped up the refuse from it with dustpan.
sentences.chinese: 扫完地以后，我从地上用簸箕撮走了垃圾。

sentences.english: The lawyer sucked in his cheeks whenever he was thinking hard.
sentences.chinese: 这位律师每当沉思时便撮紧腮帮子。

sentences.english: Shape the glutinous rice into balls and serve with ripe mango cubes.
sentences.chinese: 糯米焖好后就可以撮成小团，配上芒果丁即可。

sentences.english: There are also some contact, this piper record a for traditional research.
sentences.chinese: 间亦有略具联络者，今撮录一篇，以供医家研究。

sentences.english: Red Men still stick themselves over with bits of his fluff.
sentences.chinese: 红种人仍然用它的撮撮羽毛粘满全身。

sentences.chinese: 整好型后，将陶泥撮成条壮，不要把条撮得太长太粗。

sentences.english: When we are fishing with a small group of Kei to the group of shrimp.
sentences.chinese: 我们钓鱼时就带了小撮箕去撮小虾。

sentences.english: Reporting an incident with a small group of hostile passengers making demands at the cockpit door.
sentences.chinese: 报告，有小撮旅客聚集在驾驶舱门口提出恶意要求。
